stepsAbsentee.stepDeadlineMouseoverText: While Alabama’s official registration deadline is October 22, registering earlier will ensure that your ballot gets to you on time.

stepInstructions.instructionText: Alabama residents can register online to vote if they have an Alabama driver’s license or Alabama non-driver ID card.
Residents without an Alabama ID can use Vote Remote to register by mail.

stepsAbsentee.stepDeadlineMouseoverText: While absentee ballot requests must be received by November 1, requesting earlier will ensure that you can receive and mail your ballot before the voting deadline.

stepInstructions.instructionText: Alabama residents can request an absentee ballot by mail with this form.
In order to vote absentee in Alabama, you need to return with your ballot a photocopy of an approved photo ID.
Completed absentee ballots must be received by noon on Tuesday, November 6.
Alabama requires that when you return your absentee ballot, you include a photocopy of an approved photo ID.

Louisiana residents can request an absentee ballot by mail with this form.

If you are voting absentee because you are a student, when you submit your first absentee ballot request you must include a copy of your student ID or your fee bill. This is in addition to any other ID requirement that might apply.
Completed absentee ballots must be received by 4:30 p.m. Monday, November 5th.

stepInstructions.instructionText: Wisconsin residents can register online to vote if they have a Wisconsin driver’s license or Wisconsin state ID.
Residents without a Wisconsin ID can use Vote Remote to register by mail.

stepsAbsentee.stepDeadlineMouseoverText: While Wisconsin’s official absentee ballot request deadline is November 1, requesting earlier will ensure that you can receive and mail your ballot before the voting deadline.

stepInstructions.instructionText: Wisconsin residents can request an absentee ballot by mail with this form.

The first time you vote absentee in Wisconsin, you need to return with your absentee ballot application a photocopy of an approved Wisconsin or federal photo ID. You are also subject to this requirement each time you change your registration name or address.
Completed absentee ballots must be received by November 6.

stepsAbsentee.stepDeadlineMouseoverText: While Wyoming’s official registration deadline is October 23, registering earlier will ensure that your ballot gets to you on time.

stepInstructions.instructionText: Wyoming residents living out of state can only register to vote by mail. You’ll need a notary public to witness your registration; check your local library or UPS Store to set up an appointment.

stepsAbsentee.stepDeadlineMouseoverText: While absentee ballot requests must be received by November 5, requesting earlier will ensure that you can receive and mail your ballot before the voting deadline.

stepInstructions.instructionText: Wyoming residents can request an absentee ballot by contacting their County Clerk.
Completed absentee ballots must be received by 7 p.m. Tuesday, November 6.
